nl.vu.ip
Interface RemoteAdServer

All Superinterfaces:
java.rmi.Remote
All Known Implementing Classes:
AdServer
public interface RemoteAdServer
extends java.rmi.Remote

This is the remote interface of the AdServer. It is implemented by the client-side stub as well as the AdServer itself. Its methods are exposed to remote clients.

Author:
Erik van Zijst - erik@prutser.cx - 07.apr.2003

Method Summary
 Ad getAd()
          This method is used by remote clients to obtain an advertisement.
 PriceList getPriceList()
          This method returns the prices for the purchasing ad space.
 void purchase(java.util.Collection ads, int certificate, int srcaccount, float amount)
          This method is used by remote clients to purchase ad space.
 

Method Detail

getPriceList

public PriceList getPriceList()
                       throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method returns the prices for the purchasing ad space. The more ads purchased at once, the lower their price (usually). The prices are returned as a PriceList object that can either be used to retrieve the prices manually, or it can calculate the maximum number of ads that can be purchased, given a budget.

Returns:
the server's pricing information.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication problem occurred.

purchase

public void purchase(java.util.Collection ads,
                     int certificate,
                     int srcaccount,
                     float amount)
              throws NotPayedException,
                     java.rmi.RemoteException
This method is used by remote clients to purchase ad space.
Money must have been transferred to the server's account at the bank before this method is invoked. Along with the advertisements, a client needs to supply the payment's certificate, as well as the transferred amount etc, so the server can verify the transaction before accepting the ads.

Parameters:
certificate - the certificate returned by the bank when it made the money transfer to the server's account.
srcaccount - the client's account number from where the money was withdrawn.
amount - the amount of money that was transferred to the server's account.
Throws:
NotPayedException - if the certificate was invalid to the bank, or when the amount was insufficient for the number of ads.
java.rmi.RemoteException

getAd

public Ad getAd()
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method is used by remote clients to obtain an advertisement.
The server returns advertisements in a round-robin fashion. The getAd() method is synchronized with the purchase() method, because the latter changes the data structure that holds the ads. A second client can not simultaneously retrieve an ad (and thus access the data structure), while a new ad is being added.
Synchronization is required because Java's UnicastRemoteObject uses a thread pool to serve concurrent client requests.
Note that because the internal price list data structure is never altered, the getPriceList() method is not synchronized.

Returns:
an ad, note that null is returned if the server is empty.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - if a communication problem occurred.
